item.title: Encypted Cross Platform Notes
item.description: Challenges I’ve tried multiple note taking solutions, including OneNote, Dropbox, Quip, GDrive, Evernote, .txt files, cherrytree, and others. They all work great in some ways, fall short in others. None work platform independent. Requirements Portability Accessible from any machine with or without a browser No service, software, or OS lock in Configure what notes are synced and what notes are only accessible locally Private I shouldn’t have to agree to have them indexed by a 3rd party End to end encryption Nice to haves vi keybindings Rich formatting Export to different formats, including markdown and pdf Same environment on any workstation Works offline Enter Spacemacs + Org Mode + GnuPG Spacemacs is emacs pre-configured with a host of plug-ins, including emacs-evil, and extensible vi layer that add vi keybindings.

item.title: Install Spacemacs & GnuPG on Windows 10
item.description: Requirements chocolatey git Using the chocolatey package manager and git, we are going to get everything up and running. choco install First, we need to open powershell or cmd in administrative mode Next, install Emacs, the Source Code Pro font, and gpg4win with chocolatey with the following command choco install spacemacs gpg4win sourcecodepro Now to add Spacemacs to our Start Menu Press win key and search for runemacs.
